Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; glaze fired red-brown; white slip; interior: glazed with two bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goat walking or grazing to right (rump, tail, underbelly and part of hind legs remaining); part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the exterior decoration, see Lemos 1991, no. 236 from Vulci.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0260) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
